headline: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From Sherwin-Williams’s Q2 Earnings Call
summary: Sherwin-Williams faced a challenging second quarter, as a flat demand environment and higher costs weighed on results, leading to a negative market reaction. Management cited persistent softness in new residential, do-it-yourself (DIY), and coil coatings segments, while highlighting that gross margins expanded for the twelfth consecutive quarter due to effective pricing and mix in the Paint Stores Group. CEO Heidi Petz acknowledged, “this was not a perfect quarter,” attributing earnings declines
